results.title: Data Engineer
results.description:
About us

ClearBank was built on the belief that banking infrastructure would no longer slow down progress. Instead, it’s the catalyst that unlocks the potential to innovate. That’s why our clients — financial institutions from fintech’s and crypto platforms, to banks and credit unions — use our API to power their banking infrastructure.

But we wouldn’t be ClearBank without our people. They’re what powers our innovative technology and the reason we love what we do every day. We’re a group of spirited people who are never afraid to challenge the norm – becoming stronger, more energised, and that much better when we’re together. It’s our belief in fairness, autonomy and choice that means our people are empowered with the tools to learn, grow, and contribute to ours and our clients’ success. Interested in joining us? Read on or visit our website for more information.

About you

You’ll be joining the Data team as a Data Engineer. Reporting to the Team Leader, you’ll be a part of a fast-growing business that is challenging the market and doing things differently.

We are rapidly expanding into a global bank and building a data team that supports this growth with a legacy free data platform which puts emphasis on frictionless integrations, automated processing, and advanced analytical capability including Machine Learning. As a Data Engineer at ClearBank you will be core to continuing the evolution of this platform, embedding data into our DNA, and enabling our customers to continue to grow at pace.

Our Data team is growing fast, and as a Data Engineer you will be building a best-in-class data platform and working closely with stakeholders from teams across ClearBank and with specialists in data management, architecture, quality, and analytics. You will be key in supporting the adoption of Data Mesh principles by building the platform and capabilities that enable frictionless self-serve data ingestion, processing, and consumption as well as mind blowing insights.

And you’ll be joining the #1 fastest-growing tech company in the UK, according to Deloitte Fast 50.

 

You will be

You will be passionate about data and how it can be used to innovate, generate opportunities, and transform how an organisation operates. While data engineering experience is a plus, a successful candidate will demonstrate they are focused on delivering incremental value to users and have experience delivering a platform / service that its consumers love to use in production. Keenness for personal development as well as taking ownership and accountability of the code you deliver, from design to monitoring it in production, is also key.

 

 

What we are looking for

Core Skills and Experience

  • Focused on delivering incremental value to users, not just on writing code
  • Able to communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders
  • Experience / desire to own solutions throughout their development lifecycle – from design & testing to deployment & monitoring
  • Automation mindset - be it testing, monitoring, or operational processes; we drive for as little manual intervention as possible
  • Infrastructure as Code (we use Terraform)
  • Scala, Python, C# and / or Java (we primarily use Scala and work closely with C# Engineers)
  • Solutions driven
  • Delivery focussed
  • Team player

Ideal, but not a showstopper

  • Experience in Data Engineering
  • Spark, Azure Data Lake, and Azure Analytics Services (we use Databricks)
  • Leveraged cloud technology to deliver scalable production platforms
  • Appreciation for event-based architecture and how this applies to a big data platform
  • Experience implementing and enabling Data Mesh principles
  • Domain knowledge in Financial Services / Banking

About what we offer

  • We’re remote-first and flexible, so work from home or visit the offices in London and Bristol
  • 27 days annual leave per year, plus bank holidays and x 2 ‘Bigger Than ClearBank’ days
  • You have the option to work outside of the UK for up to 30 days per year
  • Regular in-person and online company-wide meetups
  • A flexible option to finish early on a Friday if it works for you and your team – we call this our ‘Fresh Air Fridays’
  • Take a couple of days per year to volunteer with your chosen charity to do something bigger than ClearBank
  • Private healthcare through Healix and discounted Bupa dental cover, with employee healthy living perks and discounts through YuLife
  • Enhanced family friendly leave
  • Plus, you’ll have the opportunity to join an energetic team that’s building a bank fit for the future! 🚀

 

 

The legal bit

By submitting your CV, you confirm that you can demonstrate you have the right to work in the UK. Regretfully we are not in a position to sponsor applicants for immigration purposes at the current time. By submitting your CV to ClearBank Limited you are providing your consent for us to use the information you provide for recruitment purposes. For more information on how we manage your data go and check out our Candidate Privacy Notice on the ClearBank website to see how we process, manage, and look after your data. You are also allowing us to communicate with you by email and telephone for recruitment purposes

results.title: Sales Executive Assistant
results.description:

The Sales Executive Assistant is responsible for contacting new leads via phone calls and email, and scheduling appointments for discovery calls and product demonstrations. Detailed call and email scripts that are specific to the lead type will be provided by a supervisor. Each meeting shall be transcribed and a follow-up email shall be sent. Subsequent follow-up meetings will be scheduled as applicable. The Sales Executive Assistant shall record and report daily activities and results.

Job Type: Part-time

Work Schedule: US Time zone

Salary Rate (experience-based): $5-7/hour

Job Responsibilities:

  • Leads Generation and Management:
    • Generate leads in various platforms
    • Manage the list of contacts/ leads
    • Perform outgoing phone calls to contacts/ leads
    • Email communication to contacts/ leads
    • Schedule and facilitate meetings with contacts/ leads
    • Manage the client/prospect onboarding
  • Appointment setting
  • Transcribe contents of meetings
  • Send follow-up emails
  • Schedule follow-up meetings as necessary
  • Provide daily activity and results report
  • Performs other related duties as may be assigned from time to time

Job Requirements:

  • Proven experience as a Virtual Executive Assistant
  • This is a customer-facing role. The right candidate must be comfortable speaking with customers via phone and also virtual meetings with their camera on.
  • Lead generation and appointment-setting skills are required.
  • Well-versed in apps and tools such as but not limited to Microsoft Office, LinkedIn Sales Navigator, CRM - PipeDrive, and Decisions for SAP Solutions.
  • Must have a strong work ethic and a proactive attitude.
  • A great communicator, both written and verbal, with impeccable people skills
  • Flexible, adaptable and can handle multi-task
  • Self Starter, Dependable & Trustworthy

Why Join Us?

  • Permanent work-from-home / remote set-up
  • Competitive salary with financial incentives
  • Healthcare Insurance (WITH dental coverage)
  • Paid time off (PTO) such as sick days and vacation days
  • 13th Month Pay
  • Outstanding career growth
  • Leadership opportunities
  • Passionate, energetic & innovative work culture
  • Friendly team-driven environment
  • Skills and experience development

results.title: Senior Software Engineer - ML Infrastructure
results.description:
As a Software Engineer focusing on our machine learning infrastructure here at Baseten, you’ll build the infrastructure and services for our users to deploy, serve, and monitor their ML models.


AS AN ENGINEER, YOU

  • have diverse experiences in machine learning from the infrastructure and operationalization perspective — in this role you generally won’t spend a ton of time training new models.

  • understand core machine learning concepts and frameworks (such as PyTorch, Tensorflow, sklearn etc.).

  • have experience with ML serving, and experience using GPUs for inference.

  • demonstrate fluency with one or more general purpose programming languages, including but not limited to Python, Ruby, Javascript, or Go.

  • have experience working (or desire to work with) with container-orchestration frameworks such as Kubernetes.

  • have experience building scalable backends with modern web frameworks like Django, Rails, or Node.

  • are comfortable designing and architecting systems and can balance performance, usability and effort requirements effectively.

  • understand observability, SLA, and scalability implications, but are able to avoid premature optimization.

  • have experience establishing standards and best-practices for other backend developers.

YOUR ALSO

  • can own products and projects end-to-end; engineers and designers at Baseten also function as PMs, so we’d like everyone on the team to be able to empathize with our users, understand/write project specs, and manage the end-to-end execution of features.

  • are comfortable with navigating ambiguity and enjoy the journey as much as the destination.

  • are motivated by customer problems and find joy in creating simple, elegant solutions that avoid unnecessary complexity.

  • exercise good judgment on tradeoffs and tools needed to solve the problem and don’t over index on trendy/fashionable tech unless it’s the right tool for the job.

  • demonstrate pride, ownership, and accountability for your work and expect the same from your teammates.

OUR CURRENT TECH STACK

  • Backend — Python + Django + Postgres + Redis

  • Frontend — React + TypeScript + GraphQL

  • Infrastructure — AWS + Kubernetes + Kubeflow + Knative + Prometheus


BENEFITS

  • Competitive compensation. We aim to provide 90th percentile (or better) salaries and equity grants for every team member commensurate with their experience.

  • Remote-first work environment. The Baseten team is welcome to work from wherever they want; fully remote, based in an office, or a mix of both. Today, our team (including our founding team) is spread across the United States, Canada, and Armenia. We have an office in downtown San Francisco. We provide a $1,000 stipend for you to make your home-office comfortable and productive.

  • Quarterly in-person team summits. We get together as a team four times a year to plan, workshop, and most importantly, get to know each other better.

  • Unlimited PTO. We ask that everyone take at least 4 weeks of vacation. And we have a company-wide break between Christmas and New Year's Day.

  • 100% coverage of medical, dental and vision insurance for you and your family

  • 16-weeks fully paid parental leave (adoptive and non-birth parents included) and flexibility with schedules while returning to work

  • Company-sponsored 401(k) for you to contribute to

  • Learning and development budget. We encourage you to take classes, attend conferences, and invest in your craft and we’ll cover expenses to make it happen.

results.title: Sales Director, Customer Accounts
results.description:
Company Description

Jitterbit is a market-leading Enterprise Integration Platform as a Service (eiPaaS) & API Management (API-M) solution provider, headquartered in Alameda, CA - recently recognized by Gartner as a Leader in the Magic Quadrant for the 6th Year in a row!

Jitterbit helps businesses make faster, more effective decisions by enabling them to unify and exploit data from all sources.

Using the Jitterbit API integration platform companies can rapidly connect SaaS, on-premises and cloud applications and instantly infuse artificial intelligence into any business process. Our intuitive API creation technology enables companies to reuse business-critical applications and data to bring new offerings to market in days, not months.



Job Description

The Sales Director, Customer Accounts is responsible for deal management and personnel management across the North America CAE ( Customer Account Executive ) sales team. The ideal candidate has a minimum of 2 years related sales management experience and a demonstrated success record in sales of at least 5 years. Experience creating and managing both strategic and transactional accounts is required.        

This role reports to the VP North America sales and is fully remote.                                          

Jitterbit CAE’s ( Customer Account Executives ) are responsible for generating expansion business with midmarket and enterprise customers across all verticals.

The CAE team works closely with multiple stakeholders including Sales Development Representatives, Marketing, Partners, and Client Success Managers to identify and execute upsell and cross-sell opportunities within their list of customer accounts                                   

The major objective of the team is to over-achieve against the assigned quota through a combination of core and non-core expansion. This is accomplished via inbound opportunities sourced in collaboration with the Client Success team and outbound lead generation performed independently and in conjunction with the SDR and Alliances teams.



Qualifications

 

  • You can guide a complex sales cycle from inception to close
  • You have experience cross-selling new products/features into existing customer accounts and coaching others on how to do the same with success.         
  • You have built consistent and sustainable pipeline. You and your teams consistently achieve quota
  • You are adept at coaching how to conduct account research and can synthesize those findings into a strategic account plan
  • You pride yourself on preparation, attention to detail and forecast accuracy
  • You thrive on execution via a prescribed process               
  •  You have experience with a modern sales “tech stack” including salesforce.com, Salesloft and ABM solutions or techniques                
  • You seek to be coached rather than managed                    
  • You have a proven track record of success working in a team environment, meaning you coordinate executive and cross-functional resources. You can problem solve and know when to  involve leadership in the execution of strategic/larger opportunities



Additional Information

What You’ll Get:

  • Work for a growing leader within the Integration Platform as a Service (iPaaS) tech space
  • Join a mission-driven company that is transforming the industry by changing the way customers use API creation within business-critical processes
  • Career development and mentorship
  • A flexible, remote-friendly company with personality and heart

results.title: Concept Artist
results.description:
Methodical Games is a newly formed studio built around a fundamental set of ideals; a lean talented team, direct cross-discipline collaboration, quick iteration, and developer-driven processes. Our goal is to foster a haven for developers to push the bounds of their craft and collaborate directly with other creative minds. As our name suggests, we pride ourselves on a detail oriented approach to game development with a focus on meticulously crafted gameplay. You might even call it an obsession. We’re seeking passionate individuals from all walks of life to join us in building something great.

 

We are looking for a versatile and creative Concept Artist to help define the artistic style for a new IP built in Unreal Engine 5. Our ideal candidate will inspire the team by exploring setting, tone, and mood through original concept art that is visually cohesive and in line with the game direction.

 

Responsibilities

  • Use traditional and technological approaches to create designs and storyboards in 2D and 3D through drawing and painting.

  • Interpret initial ideas and quickly sketch drafts for review.

  • Curate reference and develop mood boards.

  • Collaborate with the Art Director and team to develop style guides for environments, characters, weapons, armor, props, and other in-game assets.

  • Proactively engage with all departments to align with high-level priorities and maintain strong lines of communication.

  • Support with textures and matte paintings for in-game use on characters, environments, and user interfaces.

  • Play and give feedback on the game. Your voice matters.

 

Qualifications

  • 2+ years of professional experience.

  • A portfolio of work demonstrating your strong artistic imagination and storytelling ability.

  • Impeccable understanding of artistic fundamentals such as perspective, anatomy, composition, color theory, lighting, form, shape, and texture.

  • Research skills and an exceptional imagination to create images of characters and places that don't yet exist.

  • A developed eye for visual mood as it relates to storytelling.

  • Strong knowledge of influential styles and appeal.

  • Confident using creative tools (Photoshop, Maya, etc).

  • Strong communication skills and the ability to collaborate with the team.

  • Excellent time management skills, to sketch and adapt images quickly within tight deadlines.

  • Passion for making and playing games.

 

Nice to Have

  • Game development experience.

  • 3D art skills.

  • Graphic design experience.

  • Experience with Adobe Substance suite.

 

Not an exact match for this role? We’d still love to hear from you! Visit our Careers Page and fill out the Open Application to apply.

 

How we work

  • Methodical Games is a remote hybrid studio with an office in Raleigh, North Carolina. We are building an office first culture centered around collaboration, but we are open to fully remote work depending on the position and candidate.

  • Everyone is a hands-on contributor and we believe in leading by example.

  • We’re a small cross-discipline team communicating directly with one another.

  • It is important to us to maintain an inclusive environment where everyone feels empowered to be themselves and do their best work.

 

What we offer

  • Competitive salary.

  • Generous equity and profit sharing.

  • Unlimited paid time off, Summer and Winter breaks.

  • Excellent health, dental, and vision insurance with 100% of premiums covered for employees.

  • 401(k) retirement plan and Flex Spending accounts.

  • Relocation assistance to the Raleigh area.

  • Centrally located office minutes from downtown Raleigh, Cary, and Durham. Walk to PNC Arena (home of the Carolina Hurricanes). Garage parking with free EV charging!

results.description:

results.title: Lifecycle Marketing Manager
results.description:
We're seeking a Lifecycle Marketing Manager you will develop the overall lifecycle communications strategy to nurture and increase prospect engagement across the full buyer journey. You will be focused on personalized content and program activation through the database by leveraging email, retargeting, digital advertising, intent, gifting and other relevant channels.



What You'll Do
  • Oversee, develop, and manage lifecycle marketing journeys and automated campaigns to engage and optimize conversions throughout the funnel 
  • Work with email operations and agency partners to maintain email automation methodologies such as triggers, attributes, segmentation, and list hygiene
  • Analyze all aspects of the buying  journey, leveraging insights to develop a strategic roadmap and execute campaigns with a focus on segmentation and content, web and digital personalization
  • Work closely with sales to collaborate on pipeline acceleration and win-back campaigns 
  • Consistently measure, report, and educate the leadership and cross-functional teams of campaign performance, adjusting strategy and as needed


What You'll Bring
  • BA/BS degree or equivalent experience
  • 3+ years of relevant growth, lifecycle, or marketing experience, developing multi-channel content strategies
  • Experience with CRM, Email Automation and ABM Platforms (Salesforce, Marketo, 6Sense or similar)  
  • Strategic and analytical thinker, comfortable using platforms like Google Analytics and Tableau
  • Bonus points: Marketo certified and/or experience using a corporate gifting platform 



How You Work
  • You are strategic - you can recognize key audiences and inflection points within the buying journey and can weave together a cohesive communication framework including email, in-app notifications and events
  • You are a strong communicator, can coordinate between multiple teams and stakeholders and leadership
  • You are process and data oriented and seek to drive scale, understand and replicate success and consistently re-evaluate and iterate on existing programs
  • You are creative and not afraid to have fun - we work with a really unique product that allows for lively and inspired campaigns
  • You can create compelling and personalized content and nurture programs that can be used throughout prospecting programs
  • You can multitask and prioritize among a lot of competing projects and initiatives
  • You are a self-starter, can work independently and are looking to carve out your own career path at a fast growth company
How we work:
• We work sane, sustainable and flexible working hours.
• We offer “take what you need” PTO, and have a genuine, supportive culture around work life balance and boundaries. 
• We are consistently building, refining and automating processes to aid our work; we encourage each team member to propose and adopt new technologies, frameworks, and processes that make us more effective as an organization.
• Some of us work near or in corporate offices (pandemic permitting) but many of us work remotely full time.
• You are empowered to choose the environment that maximizes your happiness, engagement and ability to reach our shared goals.
• We provide comprehensive benefits to reward and support our employees.      

Who We Are:
Sendoso is the leading Sending Platform that delivers modern direct mail, personalized gifts, eGifts, and other Physical Impressions™ at scale. This makes it possible to build stronger, deeper, and more trusted relationships that move everything up and to the right! We’re a Series C company with $154M in venture capital funding with more than 800+ customers and 20,000 active users. Our award-winning Sending Platform connects online and offline experiences via cloud software, automation, and real-world logistics.
Our mission is to help companies rise above the noise by eradicating spam and elevating relationships. Our goal is to enable businesses everywhere to make more human connections in a digital world.

We are unable to hire in the following states at this time: CO, HI 

Sendoso is an equal opportunity employer: we value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.
By submitting your application, you agree that Sendoso may collect your personal data for recruiting, global organization planning, and related purposes.

results.title: Assistant to Editor in Chief
results.description:
Benefits Include: 
  • Remote, flex, or in-office work environment
  • Internal promotion options
  • Unlimited PTO
  • Health, dental, vision, and life insurance
  • 401k and a financial advisor
  • Premium subscription to Calm or gym credits

We are looking for a public relations or writing professional interested in any of the listed topics and more. We accept all experience levels and provide extensive training.

Interest:
  • Politics
  • Copywriting
  • Lifestyle
  • Communications
  • Marketing
  • Book publishing

Otter Public Relations has been rated the number 1 PR firm in Florida and a top firm in the US. Our team loves working in our supportive and friendly atmosphere. We are the media agency of 2022, focusing on modern PR strategies that produce real results for our amazing clients.

You will be responsible for crafting media messages, press releases, and a media campaign. 

As a full-time Assistant Editor, you will be responsible for crafting and editing news articles — including feature articles, guest articles, listicles, and Q&A-style interviews for our clients — as well as other responsibilities key to the role.

Job Duties Include:
  • Collaborating with the Editor-In-Chief to ensure accuracy and professionalism in all written content.
  • Research relevant information to improve the quality and context of your writing and editing (note that this can take several hours and should be done at least two [2] days ahead of the due date of the article).

  • 2+ years experience writing for media and/or blog articles preferred
  • Strong project management and communication skills
  • Strong writing and proofreading skills
  • Strong time management skills and ability to meet deadlines
  • Familiarity with social media platforms, major publications, and SE.
  • Familiarity with Google Drive, MS Office, Asana, and other collaborative platforms
  • Comfortable working directly with clients, publicists, and writers
  • Detail Oriented
Education, Experience, and Other Qualities Required:
  • Bachelor's and/or advanced degree in Journalism, Writing, or another related field
  • 2+ years experience as an Editor and/or Assistant Editor in a professional setting
  • A professional portfolio of previous writing experience is required
  •  Ability to manage multiple projects/assignments simultaneously and work effectively under deadline pressure
  • Possesses strong editorial skills with keen attention to detail, grammar, and punctuation

results.title: Senior Product Manager
results.description:
Sequence exists to magically simplify financial operations for modern companies.

At the end of your career, we want you to look back at your time with Sequence and say it was the best job you ever had. 

We're remote within +/-5  hours of GMT, or you can work from our Hub in central London.

 

The role

We're looking for a Senior Product Manager who will be at the centre of all the activity at Sequence, helping us build one of the best, most innovative finance operations software platforms of all time.

Working directly with the CEO, Growth team and wider Engineering team, you will be responsible for identifying user problems, defining new opportunities and shipping new product features that will delight our customers.

 

What you'll do

  • Develop and execute our product roll-out strategy for new features.

  • Whiteboard new user experiences and optimise the flows.

  • Collaborate with a wide range of stakeholders to understand requirements, align expectations and effectively prioritise the product roadmap.

  • Design wireframes and mockups to communicate solutions with Engineering and Design teams.

  • Work with cross-functional teams to move a proposition from an initial concept through the various new product development stages to delivery and launch.

  • Conduct quantitative and qualitative research to understand user needs and industry trends, creating processes to incorporate feedback and quickly capture learnings to adapt the product for future releases.

  • Communicate constantly and deliver product vision across the company.

  • Refine and improve the product using a range of best practice techniques and emerging technologies with a focus on delivering a product that offers a differentiated and unique, quality user experience.

 

Who you'll be

  • You are a clear strategic thinker, able to produce high quality documentation to drive alignment and clarity.

  • You bring solid experience building products for business and developer-focused products in big tech companies, working in payments, fintech products.

  • You have got your hands dirty shipping features across various platforms.

  • You have a true delivery mindset, with demonstrable experience of increasing velocity and engagement within your teams.

  • You have experience in building products and experiences at scale.

  • You bring excellent analytical and problem-solving skills

  • You are empathetic to the problems our users face and are constantly learning and proposing increasingly new ways we could solve them.

results.title: Principal Character Artist
results.description:
Methodical Games is a newly formed studio built around a fundamental set of ideals; a lean talented team, direct cross-discipline collaboration, quick iteration, and developer-driven processes. Our goal is to foster a haven for developers to push the bounds of their craft and collaborate directly with other creative minds. We’re seeking passionate individuals from all walks of life to join us in building something great.

 

We are looking for an experienced Principal Character Artist to create fantastical creatures and characters for a new IP built in Unreal Engine 5. Our ideal candidate has an eye for artistic quality and will be responsible for defining the look and style for all in-game characters and creatures.

 

Responsibilities

  • Create high quality characters and creatures for Unreal Engine 5.

  • Responsible for character creation from start to finish; design, sculpt, textures, and materials.

  • Ability to clearly communicate complex feedback and art direction.

  • Work with technical artists to define guidelines for polygon budgets and material creation.

  • Work with the animation/rigging team to establish good topology for deformation and delivery processes for rigging.

  • Collaborate with design and engineering to establish a modular character creation system.

  • Work closely with design and concept art to create appealing character models that work well within the context of the game world.

  • Help define processes for making model customizations and LODs.

  • Evaluate and manage outsourcing needs.

  • Play and give feedback on the game. Your voice matters.

  • A portfolio showing the ability to translate concepts into high quality, appealing and functioning in-game assets.

  • A strong sense of anatomy, aesthetics, and appeal.

  • Knowledge of Physically Based Rendering systems and techniques.

  • Firm grasp of color theory and surface/texture creation.

  • The ability to adapt realism into stylized characters.

  • Deep understanding of UV and mesh topology including faces.

  • Proficient in DCC tools for character modeling and surfacing (Zbrush, Maya, Max, Substance, etc).

  • Passion for making and playing games.

  • Experience with advanced rendering features in Unreal Engine 5.

  • Experience with procedural art workflows (Houdini, etc)

  • Traditional sculpting skills.

results.title: Art Director
results.description:
Methodical Games is a newly formed studio built around a fundamental set of ideals; a lean talented team, direct cross-discipline collaboration, quick iteration, and developer-driven processes. Our goal is to foster a haven for developers to push the bounds of their craft and collaborate directly with other creative minds. As our name suggests, we pride ourselves on a detail oriented approach to game development with a focus on meticulously crafted gameplay. You might even call it an obsession. We’re seeking passionate individuals from all walks of life to join us in building something great.

 

We are looking for an experienced Art Director to drive the artistic vision for a new IP built in Unreal Engine 5. Reporting to the Game Director, the Art Director will oversee the efforts of the art department and set the visual quality bar for the game. Our ideal candidate is a blend of a talented artist and dedicated leader who can deliver results that beautifully enhance the design of the game within time and budget constraints.

 

Responsibilities

  • Own the artistic vision for the game and communicate it effectively across the studio.

  • Contribute individually to artistic concepts and game assets.

  • Produce and direct the creation of concept art that conveys emotion and visual tone.

  • Collaborate closely with design and engineering departments to ensure form and function are in harmony and create the best possible experience for players.

  • Inspire the team to continually raise the quality bar and improve processes.

  • Deliver effective feedback across all art disciplines, such as characters, environments, animation, and visual effects.

  • Recognize and focus the strengths of individual artists for challenge and growth opportunities.

  • Ensure the Art Department is aligned with the technical and design requirements of the game.

  • Play and give feedback on the game. Your voice matters.

 

Qualifications

  • 5+ years of art direction experience.

  • Deep understanding of art fundamentals, influential styles, anatomy, and appeal.

  • Excellent traditional drawing or painting skills.

  • Exceptional spatial design awareness.

  • Ability to quickly and efficiently present visual concepts across the studio.

  • Experience directing and supporting artists across multiple disciplines.

  • Broad knowledge of game art disciplines and their workflows.

  • Ability to inspire positivity with the team and trust with other departments.

  • Experience working with art outsourcing.

  • Passion for making and playing games.

 

Nice to Have

  • Game industry art direction experience.

  • Hands-on development experience within Unreal Engine.

  • Experience with procedural art workflows.

  • Shipped console game experience.

 

Not an exact match for this role? We’d still love to hear from you! Visit our Careers Page and fill out the Open Application to apply.

 

How we work

  • Methodical Games is a remote hybrid studio with an office in Raleigh, North Carolina. We are building an office first culture centered around collaboration, but we are open to fully remote work depending on the position and candidate.

  • Everyone is a hands-on contributor and we believe in leading by example.

  • We’re a small cross-discipline team communicating directly with one another.

  • It is important to us to maintain an inclusive environment where everyone feels empowered to be themselves and do their best work.

 

What we offer

  • Competitive salary.

  • Generous equity and profit sharing.

  • Unlimited paid time off, Summer and Winter breaks.

  • Excellent health, dental, and vision insurance with 100% of premiums covered for employees.

  • 401(k) retirement plan and Flex Spending accounts.

  • Relocation assistance to the Raleigh area.

  • Centrally located office minutes from downtown Raleigh, Cary, and Durham. Walk to PNC Arena (home of the Carolina Hurricanes). Garage parking with free EV charging!

results.title: Senior Data Engineer

EasyKnock is the country’s first home equity solutions platform. Our innovative programs give homeowners flexible, quick solutions for their financial needs. Whether paying off debt, purchasing a new home, or funding a business, EasyKnock empowers homeowners to convert their equity to cash without strict lender qualifications through our suite of sale-leaseback solutions.   • Ability to quickly understand EasyKnock products, how source systems generate data, and how data is organized in the data mart

results.title: Data Analysis Mentors/Tutors (f/m/d)
results.description:
We created CareerFoundry to help others build their careers while maintaining personal freedom and flexibility. Our 100% online, flexible, mentor/tutor driven courses are setting the standard for globally accessible technical education. Through our online programs, expert tutors and mentors bring students from complete beginners to junior data analysts in 6 months.

We are searching for experienced and passionate Junior and Senior Data Analysts to join our pool of experts. Help define the next generation of talent by educating and empowering students across the globe while working remotely and around your own schedule!

Your Mission:

Mentoring with CareerFoundry is more than teaching. It’s inspiring newcomers to the field to build, to problem solve, to think like an analyst, and to increase their value as professionals.

**Based on your application and experience, we will make a decision on whether the Tutor or Mentor role is the perfect fit for you.

Mentor role:

Students need more than help and experience to master the necessary skills, they need inspiration and motivation to keep them focused along the way. You're their point of entry into a new industry, so they’ll want to hear about challenges you have overcome and what the role is really like on a day-to-day basis.

  • Suggesting supplemental learning materials and personal insights in areas where students are struggling.

**We are currently prioritizing applicants based in Northern America & adjacent timezones**

Data Processing and Querying

Data Visualization and Reporting

  • End-to-end analysis
  • Tableau

  • Statistical Analysis

Business

  • Understanding and formulating business metrics/KPIs
  • Understanding how data relates to product requirements

results.title: Senior Backend Engineer (Python)
results.description:
About this role:

The mission for the Senior Backend Engineer is to build and improve the products and services of the platform as a member of an agile team that serves carriers and shippers in the Vehicle Transportation Industry of the United States.

 

Responsibilites:
  • Work closely with your team (design, engineering, product, analytics) to figure out and deliver innovative solutions that will drive your team's key metric.
  • Own the technical part of Product-Led initiatives inside and outside of the products.
  • Document, develop, refactor, deploy, and operate APIs, customer-facing and/or internal components/interfaces that serve Super Dispatch customers.
  • Communicate with QA and Support to investigate and fix bugs.
Candidate Experience:
  • You have at least 4 years of professional experience in general, at least 2 years of which is experience working in a product-driven environment.
  • You are fluent in at least one Python web framework, such as Django, Flask, Starlette, etc. and willing to build and maintain services in different Python web frameworks.
  • You have a passion about algorithms and data structures
  • You have experience with relational databases.
  • You have a good understanding of Systems Design.
  • You are a constant learner, you can pick up new programming frameworks and concepts quickly.
  • You care about quality and you know what it means to ship high-quality code.
  • You are familiar and have experience with good engineering practices.
Plus points:
  • You have a hands-on experience building on cloud platforms like GCP / AWS.
  • You have experience in object-oriented programming languages, especially Java.
  • You have a hands-on experience with Kubernetes.
  • You have experience designing, building and running distributed systems (e.g., microservices) in a production environment.
  • You have a hands-on experience with CI/CD pipelines
  • You are familiar with testing tools
Candidate Profile:

If you consider yourself an eager learner, a conscientious worker, and a thoughtful, kind, supportive human, you might just thrive at Super Dispatch.

To be successful, you will need a combination of problem-solving, technical, and communication skills. We expect you are:

  • Thoughtful problem-solving: For you, problem-solving starts with a clear and accurate understanding of the context. You can decompose tricky problems and work towards a clean solution, by yourself or with teammates. You're comfortable asking for help when you get stuck.constraints.
  • Working in production: You have experience debugging systems in production. You appreciate the skill and challenge of replacing production components with minimal user disruption. You are able to be on an on-call rotation.
  • Pragmatic and business-oriented: You care about business impact and prioritize projects accordingly. You're not just going after cool stuff—you understand the balance between craft, speed, and the bottom line.
  • Not ideological about technology: To you, technologies and programming languages are about tradeoffs. You may be opinionated, but you're not ideological and can learn new technologies as you go.
  • Excellent communication, interpersonal, and organizational skills - you are a great writer, speaker, and listener. You can communicate technical concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences.
  • Team player - you have a collaborative mindset and the ability to build positive relationships with individuals across the organization.
  • Open and positive - you have the willingness to learn and are open to criticism and new ideas.
  • Proactive - you act without being told what to do and regularly bring new ideas and perspectives.
  • Highly motivated - you are a self-starter with a strong work ethic.
  • Flexibility - you adjust quickly to changing priorities and conditions, you respond positively to complexity and change.
  • Sense of urgency - you thrive in a fast-paced, get-it-done environment
Growth Plan:

Within 1 month, you'll…

  • Graduate from Super Dispatch's company-wide new employee onboarding program. You'll get caught up with who we are, how we work, and what we're building.
  • Understand the full functionality of Super Dispatch products, as well as the greater auto transportation industry and competitive landscape.
  • Have knowledge on how applications run on the cloud, how the performance is measured, how development and deployment are managed.
  • Understand the main parts of the codebase and have reviewed some code.

Within 3 months, you'll…

  • Collaborate on technical projects across teams within Super Dispatch.
  • Collaborate with engineers, product managers, and designers to tackle the interesting and challenging problems for building and growing an end-to-end (vehicle) shipping platform in the United States.

Within 6 months, you'll…

  • Start expanding your involvement and work with different teams on their challenges and improvements.
  • Be a valued member of an autonomous, cross-functional agile team with its mission, comprised of a product manager, UX designer, a frontend engineer, and a QA engineer.
  • Architect, design, document, develop, deploy, and operate Python services that serve platform users

Within 12 months, you'll…

  • Be a technical leader within the team you work with and within Super Dispatch in general.
  • Be a leader of the backend developer community of Super Dispatch affecting and driving our architecture across the company.

What we do:

Super Dispatch is one of the fastest growing tech startups in Kansas City, and we're transforming the world of vehicle shipping. The Super Dispatch platform is a one-stop-shop for everything Carriers and Shippers need to move cars faster, smarter, and easier. Backed by cutting edge technology and best-in-class software, Super Dispatch is the advanced auto transport experience taking carriers and shippers into the future.

Who we are:

Our diverse team is composed of highly motivated professionals with a passion for solving big problems with technology. Our core values are built around learning, growing, evolving, and continuous experimentation. We believe and practice taking bold risks. We embrace failure as a lesson. We put our team first. We are committed to supporting each other and helping each other grow on this journey.
